post.description:
Use this endpoint to request list of all available FedEx services, shipment special, service options along with delivery signature options and return shipment types that are available between an origin and destination. You can filter the results using FedEx carrier code(s) and/or service type(s) for specific services.
Note: FedEx APIs do not support Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) mechanism.

errors.message: The packaging is required and cannot be null or empty.
Access token expired. Please modify your request and try again.
We could not authorize your credentials. Please check your permissions and try again
The resource you requested is no longer available. Please modify your request and try again.
We encountered an unexpected error and are working to resolve the issue. We apologize for any inconvenience. Please check back at a later time.
The service is currently unavailable and we are working to resolve the issue. We apologize for any inconvenience. Please check back at a later time.

parameters.name: x-customer-transaction-id
parameters.description: This element allows you to assign a unique identifier to your transaction. This element is also returned in the reply and helps you match the request to the reply.

parameters.name: content-type
parameters.description: This is used to indicate the media type of the resource. The media type is a string sent along with the file indicating format of the file.

parameters.name: x-locale
parameters.description: This indicates the combination of language code and country code. Click here to see Locales

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: This indicates the authorization token for the input request.

x-code-samples.source:
<?php

$request = new HttpRequest();
$request->setUrl('https://apis-sandbox.fedex.com/availability/v1/specialserviceoptions');
$request->setMethod(HTTP_METH_POST);

$request->setHeaders(array(
  'Authorization' => 'Bearer ',
  'X-locale' => 'en_US',
  'Content-Type' => 'application/json'
));

$request->setBody(input); // 'input' refers to JSON Payload

try {
  $response = $request->send();

  echo $response->getBody();
} catch (HttpException $ex) {
  echo $ex;
}

import requests

url = "https://apis-sandbox.fedex.com/availability/v1/specialserviceoptions"

payload = input # 'input' refers to JSON Payload
headers = {
    'Content-Type': "application/json",
    'X-locale': "en_US",
    'Authorization': "Bearer "
    }

response = requests.post(url, data=payload, headers=headers)

print(response.text)

transactionId.description:
The transaction ID is a special set of numbers that defines each transaction.
Example: 624deea6-b709-470c-8c39-4b5511281492

customerTransactionId.description:
This element allows you to assign a unique identifier to your transaction. This element is also returned in the reply and helps you match the request to the reply.
Example: AnyCo_order123456789

AvailabilitycxsResponseVO.description: This is a wrapper class for outputVO

alerts.description: The cxs alert type, alert code, and alert message.

serviceOptionsList.description:
The list of options applicable when special service option is selected. The options include:
-Service types
-Signature options
-Package Special services list
-Return shipment list
-Carrier code
-Battery option list
-Alert list
-Shipment special services ist
-Cxs alerts

SpecialServicesOptionsOutputVO.description: The response elements for the special service availability request.

serviceType.description:
Indicates the type of service that is used to ship the package.
Example: INTERNATIONAL_FIRST
Click here to see Service Types

issEnabled.description: Specifies if international signature options are available.

signatureOptionsList.description: All possible signature options if signature options are available.  Indicated by the issEnabled boolean.

packageSpecialServicesList.description: Indicates the list of special services that are available at package level for some or all service types.

carrierCode.description:
Specify the four letter code of a FedEx operating company that meets your requirements
Examples of FedEx Operating Companies are:
  • FDXE - FedEx Express
  • FDXG - FedEx Ground
  • FXSP - FedEx SmartPost
  • FXCC - FedEx Custom Critical.

shipmentSpecialServicesList.description: Indicates the list of special services that are available at the shipment level for some or all service types.

OptionalServices.description: Holds the details of OptionalServices for the SpecialServiceOptions and PackageAndServiceOptions Endpoints

CodeDisplayTextVO.description: applicable key and display text value pairs.

subType.description: Specifies sub-type of the special service option.

specialServiceType.description:
Indicate the types of special services requested for the shipment.
Click here to see Package level Special Service Types

batteryPackingType.description: Describe the packing arrangement of the battery or cell with respect to other items within the same package.

batteryRegulatoryType.description: This is a regulation specific classification for the battery or the cell.

batteryMaterialType.description: Indicate the material composition of the battery or cell.

BatteryDetail.description: Provide details about the batteries or cells that are contained within this specific package.

KeyDisplayTextVO1.description: this object holds applicable key and display text value pairs.

subType.description: Specifies sub-type of the special service option

value.description: Specifies the value of the special service option.

specialServiceType.description:
Specify special services requested for the package.
Example: BROKER_SELECT_OPTION
Click here to see Shipment Level Special Service Types.

ShipmentSpecialServiceOption.description:
FedEx Shipment Special Services options.
Click here to see Shipment Level Special Service Types

The transaction ID is a special set of numbers that defines each transaction.
Example: 624deea6-b709-470c-8c39-4b5511281492

This element allows you to assign a unique identifier to your transaction. This element is also returned in the reply and helps you match the request to the reply.
Example: AnyCo_order123456789

message.description:
Indicates the description of API error alert message.
Example: The packaging is required and cannot be null or empty

CXSError.description: Indicates error alert when suspicious files, potential exploits and viruses found while scanning files , directories and user accounts. This includes code, message and parameter

value.description: Identifies the error option to be applied.

key.description: Indicates the value associated with the key.

Parameter.description: List of parameters which indicates the properties of the alert message.

The transaction ID is a special set of numbers that defines each transaction.
Example: 624deea6-b709-470c-8c39-4b5511281492

Example: Access token expired. Please modify your request and try again.

The transaction ID is a special set of numbers that defines each transaction.

accountNumber.description: Account number associated with a Payor object. Example: Your account number

carrierCodes.description:
Optionally supplied to restrict the results to services for a specific carrier. Valid values are: FDXE, FDXG, FXSP.
Example: ["FDXG", "FDXE"]

Full_Schema_Special_Service_Options.description: The request elements for special service options availability.

SpecialServicesRequestedShipment.description: The shipment details for which special service availability is requested.

shipper.description:
Required.
Indicate the Shipper contact details for this shipment.

recipient.description: Specifies the recipient details, such as postal code, state or province code, and country code of the recipient. Note: At least one recipient is required.

serviceType.description:
Indicate the FedEx service type used for the shipment. The result will be filtered by the serviceType value indicated.If a serviceType is not indicated, then all the applicable services and corresponding rates will be returned.
Example: STANDARD_OVERNIGHT
Click here to see Service Types

packagingType.description:
Specifies packaging Type.
Click here to see Package Types

shipDateStamp.description:
Conditional. Used to filter results to a specific ship date if populated on the request. Value will be defaulted to the current date/time.
Format: [YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssTZD]
Example: 2020-10-13T11:00:00TZD
Note:
1.The date format must be YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssTZD.
2.The time must be in the format: HH:MM:SS using a 24-hour clock.
3.The date and time are separated by the letter T, such as 2015-03-25T09:30:00.
4.The time is local to the pickup postal code.
5.Do not include a TZD (time zone designator) as it will be ignored.
Example: 2019-11-15T11:00:00

requestedPackageLineItems.description:
Conditional.
Specifies the packaging type, weight, and dimensions of the package. Applicable for EXPRESS and GROUND but not for FREIGHT shipments.

dropoffType.description:
Conditional
Required for Express and Ground, but optional for FREIGHT or SMARTPOST
Example: DROP_BOX

pickupType.description:
Indicate the pickup type method by which the shipment to be tendered to FedEx.
Note: The value of this element does not specify dispatching the courier for package pickup.
Click here for more information on Pickup Types.

RequestedShipment.description: shipment information for the shipment being requested

Party.description: optional information about sender/recipient including Address, Contact, Account number.

streetLines.description:
This is a combination of number, street name, etc.
Note: At least one line is required and streetlines more than 3 will be ignored. Empty lines should not be included.
Example: [\"10 FedEx Parkway"\, \"Suite 302"\]

city.description:
This is a placeholder for City Name.
Example: Beverly Hills

stateOrProvinceCode.description:
This is a placeholder for State or Province code.
Example: CA
Click here to see State/Province Code

postalCode.description:
This is the Postal code. This is Optional for non postal-aware countries. Max length is 10.
Example: 65247
Click here to see Postal aware countries

countryCode.description:
This is a Two-letter country code.Max length is two.
Example: US
Click here to see Country Codes

residential.description: Indicate whether this address is Residential as opposed to Commercial.

Address.description: This is detailed information on physical location. May be used as an actual physical address (place to which one could go), or as a container of address parts which should be handled as a unit (such as a city-state-ZIP combination within the US). Country code is required. Postal code is required for postal aware countries.

personName.description:
Specify the recipient contact person's name. Max Length is 70.
Example: John Taylor

emailAddress.description:
Contact person's email address. Max length is 80.
Example: sample@company.com

phoneNumber.description:
Contact person's phone number. Max length is 15.
Example: 1234567890

phoneExtension.description:
contact person's phone extension. Max length is 6.
Example: 91

faxNumber.description:
Contact person's fax number. Max length is 15.
Example: 956123

companyName.description:
Specify contact person's company name. Max length is 35.
Example: FedEx

Contact1.description: Contact details for the Party such as Name, Email, PhoneNumber

value.description: This is the account number. Max Length is 9. Example: Your account number

AccountNumber1.description: This is FedEx account number details.

physicalPackaging.description:
Specify the packaging used.
Example: FEDEX_PAK
Click here to see Package Types

groupPackageCount.description:
Indicate the grouped package count. These are number of identical package(s) each with one or more commodities.
Example: 2

itemDescriptionForClearance.description: Describe the content of the package for customs clearance purposes. This applies to intra-UAE, intra-Columbia and intra-Brazil shipments.

customerReferences.description: These are additional customer reference data for commercial invoice.

customerReferenceType.description:
This is a customer reference type. Note: Use type as RMA_ASSOCIATION and value as the RMA Number to associate Ground Call Tag shipments to the outbound shipment.
For more information, click here for Cutsomer References

value.description:
This is a customer reference type value.
Example: 3686

RequestedPackageLineItemContentRecord.description: Specify in details the contents of the package.

itemNumber.description:
This is a package item number.
Example: 45673289

receivedQuantity.description:
This is the package item quantity.
Example: 2

description.description: This is the description of the package item.

partNumber.description:
This is the part Number
Example: 123

InsuredValue.description: This is the Declared Value represents FedEx maximum liability in connection with a shipment of that Package, including but not limited to, any loss, damage, delay, misdelivery, any failure to provide information, or misdelivery of information relating to the Shipment.

amount.description:
This is the amount. Max length 18 including decimal.
Example: 12.45

currency.description:
This is the currency code for the amount.
Example: USD
Click here to see Currency Codes

Money.description: Optional, but if indicated 'amount' and 'currency' must be provided.

units.description:
This is package weight type.
Example: KG

value.description:
Weight Value.
Example: 68.25
Click here to see Weight Values

Weight_With_Link.description: These are the package weight details.

units.description:
Specifies the package weight unit type.
Example:KG

value.description:
Weight Value.
Example: 68.25
Click here to see Weight Values

Weight_Without_Link.description: These are the package weight details.

units.description:
Specifies the package weight unit type.
Example:KG

batteryMaterialType.description: Describes the material composition of the battery or cell.

units.description: Specify the unit of measurement used to weigh the shipment. The package and commodity weight unit should be the same else the request will result in an error.

value.description:
Specify the value of weight of shipment.
Example: 68.25

Weight1.description:
Specify the total weight of the shipment.
This is only applies to International shipments and should be used on the first package of a multiple piece shipment. This value contains 1 explicit decimal position.

Dimensions.description:
Indicate the dimensions of the package.
Following conditions will apply:
  • Dimensions are optional but when added, then all three dimensions must be indicated.
  • Dimensions are required with YOUR_PACKAGING package type.
Note: The maximum/minimum dimension values varies based on the services and the packaging types. Refer FedEx Service Guide for service details related to DIM Weighting for FedEx Express and oversize conditions for FedEx Express and FedEx Ground.

height.description:
Indicate the height of the package. No implied decimal places. Maximum value: 999
Example: 10

length.description:
Indicate the length of the package. No implied decimal places. Maximum value: 999
Example: 20

units.description:
Indicate the Unit of measure for the provided dimensions.
Valid Values are:
  • IN - inches
  • CM - centimeters
Note: Any value other than CM including blank/null will default to IN.
Example: CM

width.description:
Indicate the width of the package. No implied decimal places. Maximum value: 999
Example: 10

length.description:
Indicate the length of the package. No implied decimal places. Maximum value: 999
Example: 20

width.description:
Indicate the width of the package. No implied decimal places. Maximum value: 999
Example: 10

height.description:
Indicate the height of the package. No implied decimal places. Maximum value: 999
Example: 10

units.description:
Indicate the Unit of measure for the provided dimensions.
Valid Values are:
  • IN - inches
  • CM - centimeters

    • Note: Any value other than CM including blank/null will default to IN.
    Example: CM

Dimensions1.description:
Indicate the dimensions of the package.
Following conditions will apply:
  • Dimensions are optional but when added, then all three dimensions must be indicated.
  • Dimensions are required with YOUR_PACKAGING package type.
Note: The maximum/minimum dimension values varies based on the services and the packaging types. Refer FedEx Service Guide for service details related to DIM Weighting for FedEx Express and oversize conditions for FedEx Express and FedEx Ground.

signatureOptionType.description:
Indicate the Signature Type.
Valid Values:
  • ADULT - Adult signature required, at recipient address.
  • DIRECT - Signature required, at recipient address.
  • INDIRECT - Signature required, alternate address is accepted.(This option is available for residential deliveries only)
  • NO_SIGNATURE_REQUIRED - Signature is not required.
  • SERVICE_DEFAULT - Signature handled as per current Service Guide.

pieceCountVerificationBoxCount.description: Provide the pieceCount or VerificationBoxCount for batteries or cells that are contained within this specific package.

specialServiceTypes.description:
Special services requested for the shipment.
Example:
  • RETURN_SHIPMENT
  • BROKER_SELECT_OPTION
  • CALL_BEFORE_DELIVERY
  • COD
  • CUSTOM_DELIVERY_WINDOW
Click here to see Shipment level Special Service Types

standaloneBatteryDetails.description: Provide details about the batteries or cells that are contained within this specific package.

PackageSpecialServicesRequested.description: These are special services that are available at the package level for some or all service types.

signatureReleaseNumber.description:
This is the release number. Required if signature option is NO_SIGNATURE_REQUIRED.
Example: 23456

SignatureOptionDetail.description: These Signature option details.Required  if SignatureOptions is indicated.

alcoholRecipientType.description:
Specify the Alcohol Recipient Type of the shipment.
Example:
  • LICENSEE- FedEx approved alchol shipper having appropriate licenses.
  • CONSUMER- Individual consumer to whom the alchol is shipped.

shipperAgreementType.description: Specify the type of entity, the shipper for alcohol shipment is registered such as fulfillment house, retailer or a winery.

AlcoholDetail.description: These are details for the package containing alcohol. This is required for alcohol special service. The alcoholRecipientType is required.

accessibility.description:
Specify the Dangerous Goods Accessibility Type. Valid Values:
  • INACCESSIBLE - It does not have to be accessible on the aircraft.
  • ACCESSIBLE - It must be fully accessible on the aircraft, and is more strictly controlled.

options.description: Indicate the kind of content being reported.

DangerousGoodsDetail.description: Use this object to provide Dangerous Goods Detail in the shipment.

PackageSpecialServicesRequestedCodDetail.description: For Ground-only COD, populate this object for COD detail information at the package level.

CodDetail.description:
Conditional
For Express-only COD, populate this object for COD detail information at the shipment level. When data is provided in this object, the related COD enum will be populated automatically by RATC

codCollectionAmount.description: Use this object to specify amount and currency details.

codCollectionType.description: Identifies the type of funds FedEx should collect upon shipment delivery.

RequestedShipmentVariableHandlingChargeD.description:
Optional

Provide any Variable Handling Charge details

rateElementBasis.description:
Description of the percentage
Example: NET_CHARGE

RequestedShipmentFreightShipmentDetail.description:
Conditional
Required when using FEDEX_FREIGHT and FEDEX_NATIONAL_FREIGHT services or FXFR carrier code

alternateBilling.description:
Optional : Designates a bill-to address
Example: true

lineItem.description:
Required

Class/weight pairs and associated details for a Freight shipment

role.description:
Required
Indicates the role of the party submitting the transaction
Example: SHIPPER

clientDiscountPercent.description:
Conditional
This is only used for anonymous rate requests
Example: 10.5

aliasID.description:
Conditional.
This is bill to alias identifier.

totalHandlingUnits.description:
Optional

Total number of individual handling units in the entire shipment (for unit pricing). May not be negative

FreightShipmentDetail.description:
Conditional

Details specific to a FedEx Freight LTL shipment (i.e. FedEx Priority and Economy Freight). If freight shipment detail is applicable, then the following fields are required. 'aliasID', 'clientDiscountPercent', 'fedExFreightAccountNumber', 'fedExFreightBillingContactAndAddress', 'lineItem', and 'role'.

pieces.description:
Optional
Total number of pieces
Example: 1

handlingUnits.description:
Optional
Number of individual handling units to which this line applies. (NOTE - Total of line-item-level handling units may not balance to shipment-level total handling units)
Example: 1

freightClass.description: Specify the freight class based on the item to be shipped and its weight measured per unit volume(Example: Kilograms per Cubic Meter) the shipment is categorized accordingly.Click here to use Freight class calculator

description.description:
Customer-provided description of this line item
Example: Description

weight.description: Total weight of items for this line item

packaging.description:
Packaging type for this line item
Example: SELFPACKAGE

classProvidedByCustomer.description:
defaults to false. FEDEX INTERNAL USE ONLY for FedEx system that estimate freight class from customer-provided dimensions and weight
Example: true

hazardousMaterials.description:
Indicates the kind of hazardous material content in this line item
Example: HAZARDOUS_MATERIALS

dimensions.description: Individual line item dimensions. Conditionally required. Need volume for intra mexico rates.

FreightShipmentLineItem.description: Description of an individual commodity or class of content in a shipment.

Volume.description:
Individual line item volume.
Conditionally required.
Need volume for intra mexico rates

units.description:
The unit is in Cubic Feet or Cubic Meters.
Example: CUBIC_FT

Volume1.description:
Optional

Individual line item volume.

Conditional

Need Volume or Rate for intra mexico rates

FedExFreightBillingContactAndAddress.description:
Conditional

Required if a FedEx Freight account number is specified

address.description: Billing address information for FedEx Freight Shipment.

contact.description: Billing contact information for FedEx Freight Shipment.

ContactAndAddress.description: Specifies the contact and address details of a location.

emailAddress.description: Specify contact email address. Max length is 80.

phoneNumber.description: Specify contact person's phone number. Max length is 15.

phoneExtension.description: Specify contact person's phone extension. Max length is 6.

faxNumber.description: Specify contact person's fax number. Max length is 15.

Contact.description: Indicate the contact details for this shipment.

ContactAncillaryDetail.description: Indicate additional contact details such as email and phone information.

emailNotificationFormatType.description: These are email notification format type.

permissions.description: This is to specify the phone permission.

usage.description: Specify if the phone usage is Primary or Secondary.

areaCode.description: Indicate the Area Code for the phone number.

extension.description: Indicate the extension for the phone number.

countryCode.description:
The two-letter code used to identify a country.
Example: US
Click here to see Country Codes

personalIdentificationNumber.description: Indicate the Personal Identification Number associated with the phone number.

localNumber.description: Indicate the local phone number for contacting in the event of an emergency.

PhoneNumber.description: A phone number for a party. Numeric only

division.description: This is division within a company.

department.description: This is department within a company

storeId.description: This is Store identifier within a company.

CompanyName.description: Use this to provide Company details.

locationInCity.description:
This is the Subdivision or community within a city for the given address.
Forester subdivision

suite.description: This is the suite information for the given address.

addressVerificationOverrideReason.description:
Specifies the reason to override address verification.
Valid values: CUSTOMER_PREFERENCE, CUSTOMER_PROVIDED_PROOF, MANUAL_VALIDATION

locationInProperty.description:
This is location in a campus, such as exterior building annex A.
Example: south west of main office entrance.

addtionalDescriptions.description:
Specifies any additional information about the given address.
Example: north door

department.description:
This is the department for the given address.
Example: Claims department

roomFloor.description:
This is to specify the room or floor information for the given address.
Example: 5th floor

crossStreet.description:
This is the cross street information for the given address.
Example: Union and Main

building.description:
This is the building information for the given address.
Example: Building 300

apartment.description:
This is the apartment information for the given address.
Example: Apartment 1503

room.description:
This is room specific information for the given address.
Example: Room B-23

AddressAncillaryDetail.description: specifies additional address details for the physical location

example.locationInProperty: south west of main office entrance

FreightShipmentLiabilityCoverageDetail.description: Specifies the Liability Coverage detail for Freight Shipment.

coverageType.description:
Optional
 This is the liability coverage type.

LiabilityCoverageDetail.description: This is used specify the line item level liability coverage.

CoverageAmount.description: Specifies the Liability Coverage Amount & Currency used for Freight Shipment.

FedExFreightAccountNumber.description:
Conditional

FedEx Freight account number used with FEDEX_FREIGHT or FEDEX_FREIGHT_PRIORITY service; required for account-specific Freight rates

RequestShipmentSpecialServicesRequested.description:
Descriptive data regarding special services requested by the shipper for this shipment. These special services are available at the shipment level for some or all service types. Indicated if availability for the special service is requested.
ENUM :
  • FEDEX_ONE_RATE
  • FOOD
  • FREIGHT_GUARANTEE
  • FREIGHT_TO_COLLECT
  • FUTURE_DAY_SHIPMENT
  • HOLD_AT_LOCATION

Click here to see Shipment level Special Service Types

specialServiceTypes.description:
Optional
The types of all special services requested for the enclosing shipment.
Example: FEDEX_EXPRESS
Click here to see Special Service Types

ShipmentSpecialServicesRequested.description: The types of all optional special services requested for the shipment

InternationalControlledExportDetail.description:
Use this object to specify International Controlled Export shipment Details.
Example: WAREHOUSE_WITHDRAWAL.

returnType.description: This is the return Type. Required to be set to PRINT_RETURN_LABEL for printed return label shipments. For email return label shipments returnType must be set to PENDING and pendingShipmentDetail must be set to EMAIL.

homedeliveryPremiumType.description: This is Home Delivery Premium Type. It allows to specify additional premium service options for the home delivery shipment. Can specify Evening delivery or a Date certain, or can specify appointment for the delivery.

HomeDeliveryPremiumDetail.description: These are Special service elements for FedEx Ground Home Delivery shipments. If selected, element homedeliveryPremiumType is mandatory.

merchantPhoneNumber.description:
This is the merchant phone number. Is Required for Email Return Labels.
Example: 19012635656

allowedSpecialService.description:
Indicate the allowed (merchant-authorized) special services which may be selected when the subsequent shipment is created.
Only services represented in EmailLabelAllowedSpecialServiceType will be controlled by this list.
Example :[SATURDAY_DELIVERY]

ReturnEmailDetail.description: These are Email details for the return shipment.

SaturdayDeliveryDetail.description: These are service elements for Saturday Delivery special service.

ParsedContactAndAddress.description: These are contact and address details for this special service.

locationId.description:
This is an alphanumeric identifier used for Location/Facility Identification.

Example: YBZA

Note:
  • For HAL Shipment, Location ID is REQUIRED to ensure packages are delivered to the right location.
  • Use endpoint [Find Location] in [Location Search API], to find the correct location ID for your shipment.

locationType.description:
Type of facility at which package/shipment is to be held.
Example: FEDEX_ONSITE

HoldAtLocationDetail.description:
Use this object to specify required information of a shipment to be held at FedEx destination location.

Note: This object HoldAtLocationDetail is REQUIRED, when HOLD_AT_LOCATION is chosen in the specialServiceTypes.

ShipmentDryIceDetail.description: This is the descriptive data required for the FedEx shipment containing dangerous materials. This element is required when SpecialServicetype DRY_ICE is selected in SpecialServicetype collection.

freightDirectDataDetails.description: This field provides the list of data for Fedex Direct Detail service.There can be maximum of two allowed values for this field.

FreightDirectDetail.description: Specifies the freight Direct Detail.It is used for Fedex Freight Direct.

type.description:
This field provides the type for FedexFreight Detail service.
Example:
  • BASIC
  • BASIC_BY_APPOINTMENT
  • PREMIUM
  • STANDARD

transportationType.description:
This field provides the transportation type for Fedex Freight Detail service.
Example:
  • DELIVERY
  • PICKUP

eMailAddress.description: This field provides the email address associated with the freight user

phoneNumberDetails.description: This field prvides the phone number details associated with freight services

FreightDirectDataDetails.description: This field provides the data details for Fedex Freight Detail service.

phoneNumberType.description:
This provides the type of phoneNumber being used in request.
Example:
  • FAX
  • HOME
  • MOBILE
  • PAGER
  • TOLL_FREE
  • WORK

FreightPhoneNumberDetail.description: This field provides the phone Number details for the service.There can be maximum of five types of phoneNumber which can be provided in request.

packageCount.description:
Indicates the total number of packages in the shipment that contain dry ice.
Example: 12

ShipmentDryIceDetail1.description:
Number of packages in this shipment which contain dry ice.  The total weight of the dry ice for this shipment

 Both are required to indicate dry ice

units.description:
Identifies the unit of measure associated with a weight value.
Example: LB
